title: Ticket #6420: Python submit object does not behave the same as condor_submit
description:
The Python binding object htcondor.Submit() is supposed to allow users to use the familiar submit-file keywords to submit jobs. Unfortunately, submitting the same job with condor_submit results in a different job classad than submitting via the Python the htcondor.Submit() object. Primary reason appears that the python Submit.queue() always does the most backward compatible thing, while condor_submit command-line tool checks the version of the schedd you are trying to submit to and will use the most up-to-date features that the schedd will support. This impacts file transfer, as well as the way the job’s environment is specified, and possibly a few other things.

First reported by Xin Wang in this htcondor-users thread.

Here is code that demonstrates the problem by submitting the same job via Python and via condor_submit, and then comparing the respective job classads that end up in the schedd: 

#!/usr/bin/env python

import os
import htcondor

#
# Create a submit object with a simple job
#
sub = htcondor.Submit()
sub['universe'] = 'vanilla'
sub['environment'] = '"PYTHONHOME=/my/path/to/anaconda3"'
sub['executable'] = '/usr/bin/python'
sub['arguments'] = '/my/path/to/scripts/myrun.py'
sub['log'] = '/tmp/job.log'
sub['output'] = '/tmp/test.log'
sub['error'] = '/tmp/test.err'
sub['should_transfer_files'] = 'YES'
sub['hold'] = 'true'

#
# Use HTCondor python bindings to submit the job, and
# save this job id in jobId1
#
schedd = htcondor.Schedd()
with schedd.transaction() as txn:
  jobId1 = sub.queue(txn)

#
# Now convert the job described in the submit object into a
# string containing name=value pairs, and use this string as stdin
# to condor_submit.  Save this job id in jobId2
#
job = ""
for x in sub.items():
  job += x[0] + " = " + x[1] + "\n"
job += "queue \n"
jobId2=os.popen("echo '" + job + "' | condor_submit -terse - | awk '{print $1}'" ).read().rstrip()

#
# Finally compare the two jobs.  Hopefully they are the same.
#
os.system("condor_q -l " + str(jobId1) + " " + jobId2 + " | sort | uniq -u")

The only job attributes that should be different between the two jobs should ClusterId and GlobalJobId, but unfortunately that is not the case. Behold when testing on HTCondor v8.6.6: 

[tannenba@localhost test]$ ./pytestrun.py
ClusterId = 34
ClusterId = 35
CumulativeRemoteSysCpu = 0.0
CumulativeRemoteUserCpu = 0.0
EnvDelim = ";"
Environment = "PYTHONHOME=/my/path/to/anaconda3"
Env = "PYTHONHOME=/my/path/to/anaconda3"
Err = "_condor_stderr"
Err = "/tmp/test.err"
GlobalJobId = "localhost#34.0#1506453150"
GlobalJobId = "localhost#35.0#1506453150"
Out = "_condor_stdout"
Out = "/tmp/test.log"
TransferOutputRemaps = "_condor_stdout=/tmp/test.log;_condor_stderr=/tmp/test.err"
